title: Senior Project in Computing Arts I
description: Students pursue projects of their own design over two quarters with support from faculty in a seminar environment. Project proposals are developed, informed by project development guidelines from real-world examples. Two production-course limitation. Renumbered from ICAM 160A. Students may receive credit for only one of the following: VIS 160A, MUS 160A, or ICAM 160A. Prerequisites: VIS 145A and one course from VIS 141B or VIS 145B or VIS 147B or MUS 172. Open to ICAM majors only. Department stamp required.
